Rugby-VM: England ble utklasset i finalen

02 Nov 2019, 12:10 by NTB

ENGLAND â€“ SÃ˜R-AFRIKA 12â€“32

Â«SpringboksÂ» er dermed verdensmestere for tredje gang.
Den fÃ¸rste tittelen kom i 1995, da Nelson Mandela i forsoningens tegn stilte fÃ¸rst i heiagjengen for et lag som for det svarte flertallet hadde vÃ¦rt et hatet symbol pÃ¥ apartheidregimet. LÃ¸rdag var det to av lagets mÃ¸rkhudede stjerner, Makazole Mapimpi og Lukhanyo Am, som vakkert kombinerte da kampen ble punktert et snaut kvarter fÃ¸r slutt.
Mapimpi sparket ballen bak Englands forsvar. Am sprintet etter, nÃ¥dde den fÃ¸rst og kastet til Mapimpi, som kunne spasere inn i mÃ¥lsonen. Med kampens fÃ¸rste Â«tryÂ» ble 18-12-ledelse til 25-12.

LES OGSÃ…: Han har bare Ã©n og en halv arm. Likevel er Sonny (35) blant Norges beste i rugby.



Makazole Mapimpi lÃ¸per ballen over mÃ¥lstreken og punkterer VM-finalen i rugby union for SÃ¸r-Afrika. England ble utklasset i finalen i Japan.ğŸ“· Mark Baker, AP / NTB scanpix

Noen minutter senere brÃ¸t Cheslin Kolbe gjennom pÃ¥ kant mot et demoralisert engelsk forsvar, og med 32-12 var det avgjort.
â€“ Vi har hatt mange utfordringer, men folket har stÃ¸ttet oss. Det er sÃ¥ mange problemer i landet vÃ¥rt, og vi kommer fra ulik bakgrunn og ulike raser, men vi har jobbet sammen. Vi har vist at det ikke er noen grense for hva man kan oppnÃ¥ nÃ¥r man gjÃ¸r det, sa lagkaptein Sia Kolisi, som selv vokste opp i fattige kÃ¥r i en Â«townshipÂ».
â€“ Jeg kunne aldri ha drÃ¸mt om dette. Som gutt lurte jeg bare pÃ¥ hvor mitt neste mÃ¥ltid skulle komme fra. Mange hjemme trenger bare en sjanse, og jeg hÃ¥per vi har gitt folk hÃ¥p og tro slik at vi kan jobbe sammen for Ã¥ gjÃ¸re landet vÃ¥rt bedre, fortsatte han til ITV.
â€“ Dette gjorde vi for alle de 59 millioner sÃ¸rafrikanere, sa Duane Vermeulen, som ble kÃ¥ret til finalens beste spiller.


De engelske stjernene var sjanselÃ¸se i VM-finalen i rugby.ğŸ“· Issei Kato, Reuters / NTB scanpix

Trepoengduell
De fÃ¸rste 65 av finalens 80 minutter ble samtlige poeng scoret av Handre Pollard (SÃ¸r-Afrika) og Owen Farrell (England) med trepoengspark etter regelbrudd. Pollard sendte sitt fÃ¸rste forsÃ¸k utenfor fÃ¸r det var spilt to minutter, men traff med de seks neste, noen av dem fra langt hold. Pollard scoret hele 22 poeng i finalen.
De mange trepoengforsÃ¸kene var et resultat av SÃ¸r-Afrikas fysiske dominans og de mange feilene et tydelig nervÃ¸st engelsk lag gjorde.
I semifinalen mot New Zealand viste England stor mental styrke og spilte fantastisk rugby. LÃ¸rdag lÃ¸p laget rett inn i en sÃ¸rafrikansk mur.

SÃ¸r-Afrikas kaptein Siya Kolisi omfavner Handre Pollard etter VM-finalen mot England.ğŸ“· Eugene Hoshiko, AP / NTB scanpix

Traff muren
Etter en halv time hadde britene sitt eneste virkelig lovende angrep, men SÃ¸r-Afrika greide to ganger Ã¥ stoppe hvittrÃ¸yene bare centimeter fra egen mÃ¥lsone. England mÃ¥tte nÃ¸ye seg med et trepoengspark og 6-6, men to sÃ¸rafrikanske trepoengere rett fÃ¸r pause gjorde at laget som hadde dominert omgangen gikk til hvilen med 12-6-ledelse. Intet lag har vunnet en VM-finale i rugby etter Ã¥ ha ligget under ved pause.
England mistet en av sine muskelmenn, Kyle Sinckler, med hjernerystelse allerede etter tre minutter. PÃ¥ vei inn i en takling lÃ¸p han rett inn i albuen til lagkamerat Maro Itoje. De engelske spillerne nÃ¥dde aldri opp mot sitt beste etter det.
â€“ SÃ¸lv er ikke like bra som gull, men jeg er stolt av spillerne for det de har gjort her i Japan, sa Englands landslagssjef Eddie Jones.
text:
Rugby World Cup: England were outclassed in the final
South Africa dominated the match physically and ended with dream rugby when England were outclassed in Saturday's Rugby Union World Cup final.
02 Nov 2019, 12:10 by NTB

ENGLAND - SOUTH AFRICA 12â€“32

"Springboks" are thus world champions for the third time.
The first title came in 1995, when Nelson Mandela, in the sign of the Atonement, posed first in the heyday of a team that, for the Black majority, had been a hated symbol of the apartheid regime. On Saturday, two of the team's dark-skinned stars, Makazole Mapimpi and Lukhanyo Am, beautifully combined when the game was punctured a tight quarter before the end.
Mapimpi kicked the ball behind England's defense. Am sprinted after, reached it first and threw to Mapimpi, who could walk into the goal zone. With the first "try" of the match, the 18-12 lead became 25-12.

ALSO READ: He has only one and a half arms. Nevertheless, Sonny (35) is among Norway's best in rugby.



Makazole Mapimpi runs the ball over the finish line and punishes the World Cup final in rugby union for South Africa. England was outclassed in the final in Japan.ğŸ“· Mark Baker, AP / NTB scanpix

A few minutes later, Cheslin Kolbe broke through on the edge against a demoralized English defense, and with 32-12 it was settled.
- We have had many challenges, but the people have supported us. There are so many problems in our country, and we come from different backgrounds and different races, but we have worked together. We have shown that there is no limit to what one can achieve when one does, said team captain Sia Kolisi, who herself grew up in poor condition in a "township".
- I could never have dreamed of this. As a kid, I was just wondering where my next meal was coming from. Many people at home just need a chance, and I hope we have given people hope and faith so that we can work together to make our country better, he continued to ITV.
"We did this for all of the 59 million South Africans," said Duane Vermeulen, who was named best player of the final.


The English stars were unlucky in the Rugby World Cup finals.ğŸ“· Issei Kato, Reuters / NTB scanpix

Trepoengduell
In the first 65 of the final 80 minutes, all points were scored by Handre Pollard (South Africa) and Owen Farrell (England) with a three-point kick after a break. Pollard sent his first try outside before it was played two minutes, but hit with the next six, some of them from afar. Pollard scored 22 points in the final.
The many three-point attempts were a result of South Africa's physical dominance and the many mistakes a clearly nervous English team made.
In the semi-final against New Zealand, England showed great mental strength and played fantastic rugby. On Saturday, the team ran straight into a South African wall.


SET THIS?
New report: These 13 environments inspire Norwegian football




South Africa captain Siya Kolisi embraces Handre Pollard after World Cup final against England.ğŸ“· Eugene Hoshiko, AP / NTB scanpix

Hit the walls
After half an hour the British had their only truly promising attack, but South Africa twice managed to stop the white jerseys only inches from their own goal zone. England had to settle for a three-point kick and 6-6, but two South African three-pointers just before the break allowed the team that had dominated the lap to rest with the 12-6 lead. No team has won a Rugby World Cup final after being down during the break.
England lost one of their muscle men, Kyle Sinckler, with a concussion already after three minutes. On his way into a tackle he ran straight into the elbow of teammate Maro Itoje. The English players never reached their best after that.
"Silver isn't as good as gold, but I'm proud of the players for what they've done here in Japan," England national team manager Eddie Jones said.
